page.title: 05Tourism: Pateley
page.content: Pateley Bridge often enters a competition called Britain in Bloom. The competition's aim is to make the environment more attractive by encouraging the planting of flowers and shrubs. This also improves the number of tourists because people are attracted to the town. The flowers are judged in spring, mid-summer and late August. The parks department of Harrogate looks after the plants and supplies them from their huge green- houses. Their gardeners produce the hanging baskets of flowers and they are then brought and hung around the town. Â£10 is paid by each shop for the flowers. Local farmers have given old hayracks and stone troughs to put the flowers in. Even the river is checked for litter. The competition has made Pateley a much brighter town to live in and visit.
